page.title: 03Old Castle-Castle Kennedy
page.content: The Old Castle is one of the main attractions of the Gardens. It stands opposite the Garden Centre. The Castle was known to be standing in 1482. It was burnt down in 1716. It is thought that a maid put a warming pan into a bed and the sheets caught fire. The present Earl of Stair told us that the 2cnd. Earl of Stair was returning from Paris when it burnt down. Today the ruins stand. You can go inside them. Some of the windows are barred. There used to be a spiral staircase but now there is just a round hole leading to the top. The Old Castle is just at the entrance to the Gardens, near to the walled garden. The new Castle is called Lochinch Castle and is where Lord and Lady Stair live. The new Castle is not open to the public.
